profiles.name: Chihuahua
profiles.description: The world's smallest dog breed has the largest brain-to-body ratio of any canine, making them surprisingly clever and strong-willed. Named after the Mexican state where they were discovered, these tiny dogs can live up to 20 years and often develop fierce loyalty to a single person.

profiles.name: Shih Tzu
profiles.description: This ancient Chinese lap dog was bred exclusively for royalty and has a flowing double coat that requires daily grooming. Despite their small size, they're surprisingly sturdy and we originally bred to resemble miniature lions.

profiles.name: Shiba Inu
profiles.description: Japan's oldest native dog breed is famous for the 'Shiba scream', a high pitched vocalization they make when unhappy or excited. These fox-like dogs are exceptionally clean and often groom themselves like cats.

profiles.name: Border Collie
profiles.description: Widely considered the world's most intelligent dog breed, Border Collies can learn new commands in under five seconds and follow them 95% of the time. Their intense herding instinct means they'll try to herd anything that moves, including children, cards and even shadows.
